The warning on the bottle of Keith Harri: which includes statements about flammability, skin sensitization, cancer, toxicity to aquatic organisms, and long-term adverse effects in the aquatic environment.
The ingredients listed on the bottle: including ethyl alcohol, 2-propenal, 3-phenyl, cinnamon oil, and caraway oil.
Confirmation from Food Standards Austral: FSANZ) that the listed ingredients are permitted and expected to be used as flavoring in hot cross buns.
Information from Ixom: the manufacturer of Keith Harris bun spice essence, stating that the warning is only applicable when consumed in excess and that the composition of the essence was changed in 2016 to address any potential concerns.
